title: Crawford Defeats Alvarez, Makes History with 3 Division Titles in Vegas
snippets: Terence Crawford stunned Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez on points in Las Vegas, becoming the first male fighter in the modern era to hold undisputed titles in three weight divisions.
Terence Crawford defeated Canelo Alvarez for the undisputed super middleweight championship.

Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford finally faced off last night (Sat., Sept. 13, 2025) inside a packed Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas, Nevada in one of the most anticipated fights of the history of boxing, as Alvarez was out to prove he still had plenty to offer the fight game, while Crawford was o
Terence Crawford stunned Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez on points in Las Vegas, becoming the first male fighter in the modern era to hold undisputed titles in three weight divisions.

• Crawford wins unanimous decision in Las Vegas

  • Official judges score it 116-112, 115-113, 115-113

  • Round-by-ro
Terence Crawford produced a masterclass performance against Canelo Alvarez to become the undisputed super-middleweight champion and make history in the process.

Terence Crawford became the first male boxer to capture three unified division titles when he defeated Canelo Alvarez by unanimous decision on Saturday night to win the super middleweight championship before an announced record crowd of 70,482.
titles: History-maker Crawford stuns Canelo in Vegas
Round-by-round: Crawford tops Canelo, makes boxing history
And New! Terence Crawford makes history, upsets Canelo Alvarez to become three-time undisputed champion | Highlights
History-maker Crawford stuns Canelo in Vegas
Terence Crawford stuns Canelo Álvarez to become undisputed super middleweight champion
Crawford stuns Canelo to create history in Vegas
Terence Crawford makes history with victory over Canelo Alvarez
summary: Terence Crawford defeated Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez by unanimous decision (116-112, 115-113, 115-113) in Las Vegas on September 13, 2025, becoming the first male fighter in the modern era to hold undisputed titles in three weight divisions. The fight took place at Allegiant Stadium before a record crowd of 70,482, where Crawford won the super middleweight championship.

title: FAA Seeks $3.1M in Fines from Boeing for Safety Violations
snippets: The FAA said it identified hundreds of quality system violations at Boeing's 737 factory in Renton, Wash., and Boeing subcontractor Spirit AeroSystems' 737 factory in Wichita, Kan.
The FAA is seeking $3.1 million in fines from Boeing over safety violations, including ones related to a jetliner losing a door plug panel on its fuselage midflight.

The Federal Aviation Administration is seeking $3.1 million in fines from Boeing over safety violations, including ones related to an Alaska Airlines jetliner losing a door plug panel on its fuselage in midflight. The proposed penalty is for safety violations that occurred from September 2023 throug

The Federal Aviation Administration is seeking $3.1 million in fines from Boeing over safety violations, including ones related to an Alaska Airlines jetliner losing a door plug panel on its fuselage in midflight. The proposed penalty is for safety violations that occurred from September 2023 throug
titles: FAA seeks to fine Boeing $3.1 million for safety violations, door plug blowout

summary: The FAA has identified numerous quality system violations at Boeing's 737 factory in Renton, Washington, and at subcontractor Spirit AeroSystems' factory in Wichita, Kansas. As a result, the FAA is seeking $3.1 million in fines from Boeing for safety violations, including an incident where an Alaska Airlines jetliner lost a door plug panel midflight. These violations occurred from September 2023.

title: Trump Plans Major Sanctions on Russia, Tariffs on China to End Ukraine War
snippets: Trump tells NATO members they need to cut off Russia energy purchases before he will take bigger steps to isolate Russia over its war in Ukraine.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMif0FVX3lxTE1DTmpwX3h6SnRxN3BEMGNNWm9ZcU5ucVJzZ1MtUHZ4bzJLV3dDMFhQTkh0emdSeV9zV1hRdlBrelFkTE81Q2ZpMXZOWTNFaFJQYXYtY21lM3BKaldER1RtOXNpdHN3ay11aTVzYjA0TEF6bkd2QmVUbmRxdjBOSVE?oc=5" target="_blank">Trump ties new Russia sanctions to NATO tariffs on China
President Donald Trump has repeatedly threatened to impose sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, but has so far held off from doing so.
titles: Trump tells NATO members they must move first on Russia sanctions over Ukraine
Trump ties new Russia sanctions to NATO tariffs on China - Axios
Trump says he's ready to put 'major sanctions' on Russia if NATO nations do the same
summary: US President Donald Trump has stated he will impose major sanctions on Russia, aiming to isolate the country over its war in Ukraine, on the condition that all NATO allies cease purchasing Russian oil. He suggested that NATO's efforts in the conflict are insufficient and also proposed imposing tariffs of 50% to 100% on China for its purchases of Russian oil, believing these actions would help end the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: Rubio Visits Israel Amid Tensions After Strike on Hamas Leaders in Qatar
snippets: US secretary of state says Trump was 'not happy' about the attack, but the incident will not change ties with Israel.

US secretary of state says Trump ‘not happy’ about Israel’s attack on Hamas leaders in Qatar, its first such strike against US ally

US secretary of state Marco Rubio headed to Israel on Sunday amid tensions with US allies in the Middle East over Israel’s strike on Hamas leaders in Qatar and
The diplomat will consult with Israeli officials about their coming military offensive in Gaza City, as President Trump’s efforts to end the Gaza war appear stalled.
titles: Rubio lands in Israel to discuss war on Gaza after Israeli strike on Qatar
Rubio heads to Israel amid tensions over strike on Hamas leaders in Qatar

summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio visited Israel to discuss tensions following Israel's strike on Hamas leaders in Qatar, marking its first attack against a US ally. Despite President Trump's dissatisfaction with the incident, it is not expected to alter US-Israel relations. The visit aims to consult on Israel's planned military offensive in Gaza City, amidst challenges in ending the Gaza war.

title: Trump Plans Major Sanctions on Russia, Tariffs on China to End Ukraine War
snippets: The US president has repeatedly threatened tougher measures against Moscow, but has so far failed to take action.

summary: US President Donald Trump has stated he will impose major sanctions on Russia, aiming to isolate the country over its war in Ukraine, on the condition that all NATO allies cease purchasing Russian oil. He suggested that NATO's efforts in the conflict are insufficient and also proposed imposing tariffs of 50% to 100% on China for its purchases of Russian oil, believing these actions would help end the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: Far-Right London Protest by Tommy Robinson Injures 26 Police Officers
snippets: The march, organized by far-right activist Tommy Robinson, drew more than 110,000 people on Saturday. At least 26 police officers were injured in clashes that broke out.
Far-right protesters clash with police, injuring 26 officers, four of them seriously.
London officers were attacked after a crowd of some 110,000 people gathered near Westminster for an anti-immigration protest led by far-right activist Tommy Robinson.
titles: Over 100,000 attend London rally organized by far-right activist, clashes break out
Clashes in London as 110,000 join far-right rally against immigration
UK: Clashes with police reported at huge far-right rally
summary: A far-right protest led by activist Tommy Robinson in London attracted over 110,000 participants. The event turned violent, resulting in clashes with police that left 26 officers injured, four seriously. The demonstration was centered around anti-immigration sentiments.

title: Romania and Poland Deploy Jets Amid Drone Threats, Zelenskyy Cites War Expansion
snippets: Romania scrambles fighter jets as Poland also deploys aircraft over threat of a drone attack.

This follows similar events in Poland, highlighting increased tensions in the region.

title: Poland Deploys Aircraft, Boosts Defense Amid Drone Strike Threats
snippets:
‘Preventive operations’ included putting air defence systems on high alert and followed serious Russian incursion earlier in the week

Polish and allied aircraft have been deployed in a “preventive” operation in Poland’s airspace because of a threat of drone strikes in neighbouring areas of
Polish and allied aircraft were deployed in a “preventive” operation in Poland's airspace Saturday because of a threat of drone strikes in neighboring areas of Ukraine.

WARSAW, Poland (AP) — Polish and allied aircraft were deployed in a “preventive” operation in Poland’s airspace Saturday because of a threat of drone strikes in neighboring areas of Ukraine, and the airport in the eastern Polish city of Lublin was closed, authorities said. The alert lasted aro
titles: Poland deploys planes due to threat of drone strikes in nearby Ukraine
Poland deploys planes in its airspace because of threat of drone strikes in nearby Ukraine
Poland deploys planes in its airspace because of threat of drone strikes in nearby Ukraine
summary: Polish and allied aircraft were deployed in a preventive operation in Poland's airspace due to a threat of drone strikes from neighboring Ukraine. The operation included putting air defense systems on high alert. Additionally, the airport in Lublin, eastern Poland, was temporarily closed. The alert was in response to a serious Russian incursion earlier in the week.

title: Taliban and U.S. Agree on Prisoner Swap to Boost Relations
snippets: The reported visit follows one in March 2025 which led to the release of a US citizen held for more than two years.
It's part of an effort to normalize relations with the United States.

KABUL, Afghanistan (AP) — The Taliban said Saturday they reached agreement with U.S. envoys on an exchange of prisoners as part of an effort to normalize relations between the United States and Afghanistan. They gave no details of a detainee swap and the White House did not comment on the meeting in
titles: Taliban official says US envoy agrees to prisoner swap in Kabul meeting
Taliban claim agreement reached with US envoys on a prisoner swap
Taliban claim an agreement is reached with US envoys on a prisoner swap as they seek better ties
summary: The Taliban and U.S. envoys agreed on a prisoner exchange to help normalize U.S.-Afghan relations, announced in Kabul. This follows a successful visit in March 2025, leading to the release of a detained U.S. citizen. Details of the swap were not disclosed, and the White House has yet to comment.

title: 2025 Blue Jays Set Franchise Record with 45th Comeback Win
snippets: Forty-five times there has been magic in the Toronto Blue Jays dugout.

With Saturday’s latest thrilling walk-off win, the 2025 Blue Jays can now claim the title of comeback kings, surpassing the 1993 team for most in franchise history.

David Singh has more on how Toronto flipped the script at Rogers Centre yet again.
Alejandro Kirk joins Arden Zwelling after delivering the walk-off sac fly vs. the Baltimore Orioles, saying this team is ‘incredible’ and they’re going to keep pushing down the stretch.

summary: The 2025 Toronto Blue Jays set a franchise record with their 45th comeback win, surpassing the 1993 team's record. This milestone was achieved with a walk-off victory against the Baltimore Orioles at Rogers Centre, highlighted by Alejandro Kirk's game-winning sacrifice fly. The team is celebrated for their resilience and determination throughout the season.

title: Kirk's Sacrifice Fly Seals Blue Jays' 5-4 Comeback Win Over Orioles
snippets: Alejandro Kirk's sacrifice fly in the ninth inning completed yet another Blue Jays comeback as Toronto stunned the Baltimore Orioles 5-4 on Saturday.

Watch as Toronto Blue Jays catcher Alejandro Kirk hits a ball into centre field that gets deep enough for Ernie Clement to tag up and score the game-winning run in the ninth inning against the Baltimore Orioles.

Alejandro Kirk’s sacrifice fly in the ninth capped off a three-run rally as the Toronto Blue Jays walked off the Baltimore Orioles 5-4. Addison Barger recorded his 20th home run of the season in the win.
titles: Kirk’s late sac fly lifts Blue Jays over Orioles
Gotta See It: Blue Jays’ Kirk walks off Orioles with sac fly to cap off comeback

summary: Alejandro Kirk's sacrifice fly in the ninth inning allowed Ernie Clement to score the game-winning run, leading the Toronto Blue Jays to a 5-4 comeback victory over the Baltimore Orioles on Saturday.

title: Canada Beats Israel in Davis Cup Amid Protests Over Gaza, West Bank
snippets: About 400 demonstrators opposing Israel's actions in Gaza and the West Bank held peaceful protests during Friday's matches.

titles: Canada wins Davis Cup tie with Israel in empty Halifax stadium

summary: Around 400 people protested against Israel's actions in Gaza and the West Bank during Friday's matches. In an empty Halifax stadium, Canada secured a spot in the 2026 Davis Cup Qualifiers by leading Israel 3-0 in a best-of-five tie, amidst these peaceful demonstrations.

title: Fed Gov. Cook's Condo Tagged "Vacation Home," Counters Fraud Claim
snippets: Fed Gov. Lisa Cook referred to a condo she bought in 2021 as a "vacation home" in a loan estimate, which could undermine claims by the Trump administration that she committed mortgage fraud.

Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook reportedly declared a condo she purchased in 2021 as a “vacation” and “second” home in loan filings and other documents — potentially undermining the Trump administration’s claims that she engaged in mortgage fraud, which the president used as grounds to fire Cook
titles: Fed's Cook claimed second residence as 'vacation home,' undercutting Trump fraud claims
Fed governor Cook declared second residence as ‘vacation home,’ countering Trump’s claims
summary: Documents reveal Fed Gov. Lisa Cook labeled a condo purchased in 2021 as a "vacation home" on a loan estimate, conflicting with Trump administration accusations of mortgage fraud. Additionally, for security clearance, she referred to it as a “second home,” as per The Associated Press.

title: China Launches Probes into U.S. Semiconductor Sector Ahead of Talks
snippets: The Ministry of Commerce said in a statement on Saturday that it’s opened an anti-dumping probe relating to certain American-made analog IC chips.

TAIPEI, Taiwan (AP) — China launched two probes targeting the U.S. semiconductor sector Saturday ahead of talks between the two nations in Spain this week on trade, national security and the ownership of social media platform TikTok. China’s Ministry of Commerce announced an anti-dumping
titles: China starts probes targeting US semiconductor sector
China launches probes targeting US semiconductors ahead of Madrid trade talks
summary: China's Ministry of Commerce has initiated two investigations into the U.S. semiconductor sector, including an anti-dumping probe into American-made analog IC chips. These actions come ahead of planned trade and national security talks between the U.S. and China in Spain, which will also cover issues related to the ownership of TikTok.

title: Solar Flares Far Hotter, Habitable Zone Larger Than Thought: Study
titles: Solar Flares Are 6.5 Times Hotter Than We Thought
Our Galaxy’s Sweet Spot for Life Is Bigger Than We Thought
summary: Recent scientific findings reveal that solar flares are 6.5 times hotter than previously believed. Additionally, research indicates that the habitable zone within our galaxy is larger than once thought, suggesting a greater potential for life-supporting planets. These discoveries expand our understanding of both solar phenomena and the potential for life in the universe.
